pain_points.description: Drivers are still reliant on paper manifests which need to be reprinted with every route change, leading to potential confusion.
pain_points.source_quote: paper manifests printed daily; route changes require reprint and drivers sometimes leave before updates.

pain_points.description: The application currently assumes a fixed manifest at login, preventing real-time updates for drivers.
pain_points.source_quote: app assumes fixed manifest at login; no refresh.

pain_points.description: There is a lack of real-time updates due to the absence of WebSocket or push notifications, hindering drivers' ability to receive immediate route changes.
pain_points.source_quote: no WebSocket/push for live manifest updates.

stakeholder_needs.need: Eliminate paper manifests and ensure real-time updates for compliance and audit purposes.
Implement dynamic refresh capabilities for the manifest and ensure offline support.
Reduce errors stemming from paper-based processes by transitioning to digital solutions.

key_constraints: Backend: WebSocket or push channel for manifest stream
recommended_next_steps: Discuss further with the engineering team on the feasibility of implementing WebSocket.
Evaluate potential solutions for dynamic manifest refresh and offline capabilities.
Explore options to gather quantifiable costs associated with paper manifest printing.
